( Carnage: The ship has not landed yet.)

** Vlad was suddenly jerked awake as the StarHopper hit the ocean, the 
wolf/dog like animal at his side whining.
He looked at the creature before looking towards the windshield, seeing 
nothing but blue against it, then suddenly seeing a small school of brightly 
flashing fish swim down below.
Swim?
Vlads optics grew large, HE WAS UNDERWATER!!
But before he could scramble towards the hatch the DNA sequencer activated 
and began to scan, leaving Vlad sprawled out on the floor with his pet 
looking over him.
There was plenty to scan, but Vlad had already programmed what he wanted as 
an emergency beast mode, the scanners flowing over the submerged skeleton of 
a velociraptor under the sand at the bottom of the ocean.
Yet...not the beast mode which Vlad had programmed.
Still, as the cockpit of the StarHopper filled with light his armor took on 
the shapes required to take the form of the dino when he TFed into beast 
mode.

Vlad then opened his optics, feeling no different then before.
He looks at the water against the shield, seeing small fractures in the 
glass develop, small whispers of water coming into the cabin.
Vlad jumped to his feet, watching as the water sprayed onto the controls, 
hearing the hiss before they began to spark.
There was going to be a fire in there soon!**

" Slag!!"

** Vlad whipped around the opened a small compartment in the back of the 
small ship, then pushing the panicked animal into the escape pod, him 
jumping in right after.
Vlad closed the door right behind him, his spark at a fast rate but not too 
hyper, then looking over to a release valve and punching through the glass 
that covered it.
The hissing of the pressure releasing as the pod ejects into the open ocean, 
the clear round pod floating slowly to the surface.

Vlad looks on as he sees the ship sink deeper, watching the cabin soon 
develop a orange flickering glow of a fire.
The animal whining at his side.
Vlad lays his back against the clear side of the pod, closing his optics and 
sighing, resting a hand on the pets head.**
